description: From Latin hībernātus, from hībernāre, from hībernus (“winter”).

verbs.description: hibernate (third-person singular simple present hibernates, present participle hibernating, simple past and past participle hibernated)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, biology) To spend the winter in a dormant or inactive state of minimal activity, low body temperature, slow breathing and heart rate, and low metabolic rate; to go through a winter sleep.
examples: Hedgehogs and bears are two of the many mammals that hibernate in winter.

entries.meaning: (intransitive, computing) To enter a standby state which conserves power without losing the contents of memory.
examples: Your computer hibernates after it has been idle for the specified amount of time.
